title: Combination of monetary and fiscal policies

content.question: If both contractionary monetary policy and contractionary fiscal policy are carried out, what will most likely happen to interest rates and real gross domestic product <math alttext="open parenthesis, G D P, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(GDP)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the short run?

choices.label: Both interest rates and real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase.
Both interest rates and real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease.
Interest rates will decrease, and real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will stay the same.
Interest rates will increase, and real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease.
Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease, and the change in interest rates will be indeterminate.

content.answer: Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease, and the change in interest rates will be indeterminate.

topic.text: 5.1: Fiscal and Monetary Policy Actions in the Short Run

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
